[quote=“Vira_, post:3, topic:290193”]In your client.java have you changed;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

to;

public class client extends Player {

I did, thats what the TUT says am i nt supposed to do that?

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Yodoxin Yodoxin
item.description:
@Yodoxin wrote:

Well, judging by the first error, it looks to me like you’ve missed a } somewhere above the text that appears in the error; the easiest thing to do to find out would be to paste the whole script into notepad++ with the language set to Java and see which brackets don’t match up properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @burnt_w_pwnt burnt w pwnt
item.description:
@burnt_w_pwnt wrote:

I just added thread per client, and followed the guide got no errors, until i finished it i got these errors.

[code]IOClient.java:40: illegal start of expression
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

^
IOClient.java:40: ‘;’ expected
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                  ^

IOClient.java:40: expected
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                 ^

IOClient.java:40: not a statement
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                      ^

IOClient.java:40: ‘;’ expected
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                          ^

IOClient.java:40: ‘;’ expected
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                                                     ^

IOClient.java:40: not a statement
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                                                      ^

IOClient.java:40: ‘;’ expected
public client loadgame(Socket socket, int slot, String playerName, String playerPass);

                                                                                ^

IOClient.java:229: expected
c.int level = 0;
^
IOClient.java:229: not a statement
c.int level = 0;
^
10 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

im also wondering what “illegal start of expression”, “not a statement” and " expected" Means.

Read full topic
